page.title: 05Oil exploration (cont.)
page.content: adverse effects. Friends of the Earth were concerned that any location in the South of England could face oil exploration without regard for its environmental importance. D.C.C. granted B.P. permission (12.4.85) but imposed 34 conditions including that the work should only be carried out in daylight hours on weekdays. Work began in June 1985 and B.P. adopted a deliberate policy of consideration to the islands wildlife. All employees were given a preliminary slide show and instruction on the "keep quiet" and "take care" policy. All but essential areas are regarded as "out of bounds". Radios and cassette players are banned. Machinery noise is muffled and work is confined to 7am-7pm, depending on tides.
